DOC.brief_summary: The main objective study evaluate influence metformin lactate metabolism . The main outcome lactate production follow exogenous lactate overload healthy male subject without metformin one week later metformin .
DOC.detailed_description: Study design : Physiological study , control , open , non randomise Healthy male subject , 18 30 year old Principal objective : To evaluate influence metformin lactate metabolism ( production ) follow exogenous lactate overload . - Objective 2 : To evaluate influence metformin lactate metabolism ( production ) muscular exercise . - Objective 3 : To evaluate influence metformin lactate metabolism ( elimination ) exogenous lactate overload . - Objective 4 : To evaluate influence metformin lactate metabolism ( elimination ) muscular exercise . Principal outcome : Lactate production follow exogenous lactate overload . - Outcome 2 : Production lactate follow muscular exercise test . - Outcome 3 3 ' : Parameters modelizing elimination lactate follow exogenous lactate overload ( bi-exponential model ) . - Outcome 4 4 ' : Parameters modelizing elimination lactate follow muscular exercise test ( bi-exponential model ) . Inclusion criterion : - Healthy male subject , 18 30 year - Body mass index ( BMI ) 21 25 kg/m2 inclusive - Informed consent Exclusion criterion : - Ward court guardianship ( sheltered adult ) - Adult unable express consent - Person deprive freedom judicial administrative decision - Person hospitalise without consent - Person legal protection - Existence previously diagnose pathology - Existence metabolic condition ( obesity , diabetes ) family history - Ongoing medical treatment .
